It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its leaf-like thallus that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. It is often found growing on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
